means: [用复数]（音响设备中的）独立件

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词都有"分开"之意。
means: divide ： 指把一个整体按要求分成几个部分，暗示分配之意；也可指分开两个对立的事物。
separate ： 指把两个人或物分开，着重从原属一个整体中移居一部分或把两者隔开。
part ： 多指使紧密相连的人或物分开，往往暗示最后分离的意味。
divorce ： 特指两个或更多的互为依赖的事物的分离，尤指婚姻的合法解体。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"分开，分离，隔离"之意。
means: isolate ： 侧重指完全分离、隔开，也指人或处于完全孤立的状态。
separate ： 指一般意义上的分开或隔开。
segregate ： 指把一群人或物从整体或主体中分离出来。
insulate ： 指隔开、分离，尤指用某种东西阻挡从里面逃出或从外面进入的东西。作技术用词时，专指用某种绝缘体隔断通路。

sentence.Network_en: A young man of his years needed to have a separate room.
sentence.Network_cn: 他那个年纪的年轻人需要有个单独的房间。

sentence.Network_en: The ability to separate out reusable elements from other waste is crucial.
sentence.Network_cn: 能从其他废料中分离出可重复利用成分是很关键的。

sentence.Network_en: The government, the executive and the judi-ciary are supposed to be separate.
sentence.Network_cn: 政府、行政部门和司法部门应该彼此分离。

phrase.cizu_name: separate the men from the boys
separate the sheep from the goats

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin separat- 'disjoined, divided', from the verb separare, from se- 'apart' + parare 'prepare'

entry.def: If one thing is separate from another, there is a barrier, space, or division between them, so that they are clearly two things.

example.ex: Each villa has a separate sitting-room...
example.tran: 每栋别墅都有一间独立的起居室。

example.ex: They are now making plans to form their own separate party...
example.tran: 他们如今正计划组建自己的独立政党。

entry.def: If you refer to separate things, you mean several different things, rather than just one thing.

example.ex: Use separate chopping boards for raw meats, cooked meats, vegetables and salads...
example.tran: 切生肉、熟肉、蔬菜和拌色拉的青菜时要使用不同的切菜板。

example.ex: Men and women have separate exercise rooms...
example.tran: 男女有各自的健身房。

entry.def: If you separate people or things that are together, or if they separate, they move apart.

example.ex: Police moved in to separate the two groups...
example.tran: 警方介入进来，将两拨人分开。

example.ex: The pans were held in both hands and swirled around to separate gold particles from the dirt...
example.tran: 双手握住淘选盘不停旋动将沙金和尘土分开。

entry.def: If you separate people or things that have been connected, or if one separates from another, the connection between them is ended.

example.ex: They want to separate teaching from research...
example.tran: 他们想把教学和研究分开。

example.ex: It's  very possible that we may see a movement to separate the two parts of the country...
example.tran: 很可能我们会目睹一场分裂该国这两个地区的运动。

entry.def: If a couple who are married or living together separate, they decide to live apart.

example.ex: Her parents separated when she was very young...
example.tran: 她很小的时候父母就分居了。

example.ex: Since I separated from my husband I have gone a long way.
example.tran: 自从我和我丈夫分开后，我的生活发生了很大的变化。

entry.def: An object, obstacle, distance, or period of time which separates two people, groups, or things exists between them.

example.ex: ...the white-railed fence that separated the yard from the paddock...
example.tran: 将院子和小围场隔开的白色围栏

example.ex: They had undoubtedly made progress in the six years that separated the two periods...
example.tran: 毫无疑问，他们在这两个时期相隔的 6 年间取得了进展。

entry.def: If you separate one idea or fact from another, you clearly see or show the difference between them.

example.ex: It is difficult to separate legend from truth...
example.tran: 很难将传说和事实区别开来。

example.ex: ...learning how to separate real problems from imaginary illnesses...
example.tran: 学习如何分辨真实的和想象出的疾病

entry.tran: 使得以区分;使获得区别
entry.def: A quality or factor that separates one thing from another is the reason why the two things are different from each other.

example.ex: The single most important factor that separates ordinary photographs from good photographs is the lighting...
example.tran: 区分普通照片和出色照片的一个至关重要的因素就是光线。

example.ex: What separates terrorism from other acts of violence?
example.tran: 恐怖主义和其他暴力行为的区别是什么？

entry.tran: (两个参赛队或竞争者比分)相隔，相差
entry.def: If a particular number of points separate two teams or competitors, one of them is winning or has won by that number of points.

example.ex: In the end only three points separated the two teams.
example.tran: 最终两队只相差 3 分。

entry.def: If you separate a group of people or things into smaller elements, or if a group separates, it is divided into smaller elements.

example.ex: The police wanted to separate them into smaller groups...
example.tran: 警察想把他们拆散成几小股。

example.ex: Wallerstein's work can be separated into three main component themes...
example.tran: 沃勒斯坦的作品可以细分成3个主要的主题。

entry.def: Separates are clothes such as skirts, trousers, and shirts which cover just the top half or the bottom half of your body.

entry.tran: 分道扬镳;分手;分路而行
entry.def: When two or more people who have been together for some time go their separate ways, they go to different places or end their relationship.

example.ex: Sue and her husband decided to go their separate ways.
example.tran: 苏和丈夫决定离婚。

means.word_mean: 1. a separately printed article that originally appeared in a larger publication
2. a garment that can be purchased separately and worn in combinations with other garments
1. act as a barrier between; stand between;

sentences.sentence: "The mountain range divides the two countries"

means.word_mean: 2. force, take, or pull apart;
3. mark as different;
4. separate into parts or portions;

sentences.sentence: "divide the cake into three equal parts"
"The British carved up the Ottoman Empire after World War I"

means.word_mean: 5. come apart;

sentences.sentence: "The two pieces that we had glued separated"

means.word_mean: 6. divide into components or constituents;
7. arrange or order by classes or categories;

sentences.sentence: "How would you classify these pottery shards--are they prehistoric?"

means.word_mean: 8. become separated into pieces or fragments;
9. make a division or separation
10. discontinue an association or relation; go different ways;

sentences.sentence: "The business partners broke over a tax question"
"The couple separated after 25 years of marriage"

means.word_mean: 11. go one's own away; move apart;
12. treat differently on the basis of sex or race
13. divide into two or more branches so as to form a fork;
1. independent; not united or joint;

sentences.sentence: "a problem consisting of two separate issues"

means.word_mean: 2. individual and distinct;

sentences.sentence: "pegged down each separate branch to the earth"

means.word_mean: 3. standing apart; not attached to or supported by anything;
4. not living together as man and wife;
5. characteristic of or meant for a single person or thing;
6. separated according to race, sex, class, or religion;
7. have the connection undone; having become separate

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. =bring birth,表示"生产,生出小孩"; 2. =come in sight,表示"看见;出现"; 3. =get ready,表示"准备;安置"; 4. =equal,表示"平等"

stems_affixes.value_cn: 一胎多子的, 经产的, 非初产的, [植]多产的
stems_affixes.word_buile: multi多+par生产,生出小孩+ous……的→多生产的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 初产的, 初次分娩的
stems_affixes.word_buile: primi=prim第一,最初+par生产,生出小孩+ous……的→adj.初产的, 初次分娩的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 每次产一个卵的; 每胎生一子的
stems_affixes.word_buile: uni单一+par生产,生出小孩+ous……的→生出一个

stems_affixes.value_cn: 表面上的,貌似真实的;显然的,明明白白的
stems_affixes.word_buile: ap一再+par看见;出现+ent……的→一再能看见→显而易见
trans横穿+par看见;出现+ent……的→横穿过去看得一样清楚→透明的
in不+separable[adj.可分离的, 可分的]→adj.不能分的
se分离+par置+able……的→adj.可分离的, 可分的
se分离+par置+ate表形容词→adj.分开的, 分离的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 无准备的, 即席的, 尚未准备好的
stems_affixes.word_buile: un无+prepare准备+ed……的→adj.无准备的, 即席的, 尚未准备好的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 可比较的, 比得上的
stems_affixes.word_buile: compare比较+able……的→adj.可比较的, 比得上的
compare比较+ative表形容词→adj.比较的, 相当的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 奇数的,不成对的,不平等
stems_affixes.word_buile: im不+parity[n.同等;奇偶]→adj.奇数的,不成对的,不平等
non不,无+par平等+eil→无平等的→无与伦比的
apparent显然的+ly表副词→adv.显然地
separate分开+ly表副词→adv.个别地;分离地
comparative[adj.比较的, 相当的]+ly表副词→adv.比较地, 相当地
par生产,生出小孩+ent……人→n.父母,母亲;[n.]双亲;父母

stems_affixes.value_cn: 透明, 透明度, 幻灯片, 有图案的玻璃
stems_affixes.word_buile: transparent[[adj.透明的]]→n.透明, 透明度, 幻灯片, 有图案的玻璃

stems_affixes.value_cn: 器械,器具,仪器;机构,组织
stems_affixes.word_buile: ap=ad+par准备;安置+atus表名词→准备好用的东西→设备
par准备;安置+ade表名词→本为部队训练场[即准备打仗得地方],引申为排队游行
prepare准备+ation行为,过程→n.准备, 预备
re再+pair=par准备;安置→重新准备好→修理
com一起+pari=par平等+son→一起平等→比较
dis不+parity同等→n.不同,差异
par平等→n.一对, 一双
par平等+ity表名词→n.同等;奇偶
par准备;安置+ade表名词→本为部队训练场[即准备打仗得地方],引申为排队游行
par准备;安置+ade表名词→本为部队训练场[即准备打仗得地方],引申为排队游行
pre预先+par准备;安置+e→预先准备好
re再+pair=par准备;安置→重新准备好→修理
com共同+par平等+e→平等的放在一起→比较
dis不+par平等+age动词后缀→不平等对待→轻视

Sentence.sentence: In a 2011 study, for instance, people who drank the same 380-calorie(卡路里) milkshake on two separate occasions produced different levels of hunger-related hormones (荷尔蒙), depending on whether the shake's label said it contained 620 or 140 calories.

Today, given the job losses of the past year, fewer unhappy couples will risk starting separate households, Furthermore, the housing market meltdown will make it more difficult for them to finance their separations by selling their homes.

Civilization,then,is fine — people banging away on their smartphones are fluently using a code separate from the one they use in actual writing, and there is no evidence that texting is ruining composition skills.
In the second stage, Doctor Bastian separated the dolphins into two tanks.
They tested four separate groups at four key stages of Obama's presidential campaign.
